text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Upper Franconia | native_name = Oberfranken | native_name_lang = de | settlement_type = Regierungsbezirk | image_map = Locator map RB Oberfranken in Bavaria.svg | map_caption = Map of Bavaria highlighting Upper Franconia | coordinates = | coor_pinpoint = | coordinates_footnotes = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Germany | subdivision_type1 = State | subdivision_name1 = Bavaria | established_title = | established_date = | extinct_title = Disestablished | extinct_date = | seat_type = Region seat | seat = Bayreuth | area_total_km2 = 7230.19 | population_footnotes = | population_total = | population_as_of = | population_density_km2 = auto | website = regierung.oberfranken.bayern.de | official_name = | image_flag = Flagge Oberfranken.svg | flag_size = 150px | image_shield = Wappen Bezirk Oberfranken2.svg }} Upper Franconia (, ; Main-Franconian: ) is a regierungsbezirk (administrative region) of the German state Bavaria. It has an area of 7,230 km² and about 1,200,000 people. It borders the German states of Sachsen and Thuringia, and also the Czech Republic. Bayreuth is its capital. ==Cities and districts== ===Cities which are urban districts=== #Coburg, #Bamberg, #Hof, #Bayreuth. ===Smaller cities=== #Forchheim, #Kulmbach, #Lichtenfels, #Marktredwitz, #Neustadt bei Coburg #Kronach, #Rödental, #Wunsiedel, #Selb, #Münchberg, #Helmbrechts, #Rehau, #Stadtsteinach, #Bad Staffelstein, #Ebermannstadt, #Burgkunstadt ===Districts=== #Coburg Rural District #Bamberg Rural District #Forchheim Rural District #Bayreuth Rural District #Lichtenfels Rural District #Kronach Rural District #Hof Rural District #Kulmbach Rural District #Wunsiedel i. Fichtelgebirge Rural District == References ==
title: Upper Franconia Government Region
